item.title: Returns a map
item.description: Maps are without a doubt the most useful and ubuiquitous data structure in Clojure. Therefore the core library has many functions that return a map. In this article, we'll explore some of these functions and applications for them.
item.author: cassidy

item.title: Threading macros
item.description: Threading macros are one of the most useful features of the Clojure core library. Similar to a fluent API in object-oriented programming languages, these macros are both more powerful and more flexible.
item.author: cassidy

item.title: Fun with strings
item.description: Clojure provides excellent utilities for dealing with strings. Strings are also sequences and can be treated and processed as such. In this article we'll explore a fun way to solve a common problem using sequence functions on strings.
item.author: cassidy
